datum: While the King * sitteth at his table, my spikenard sendeth forth the smell thereof.
His left hand * is under my head, and his right hand doth embrace me.
I am black * but comely, O ye daughters of Jerusalem. Therefore the King hath loved me, and brought me into his chamber.
Lo! The winter is past, * the rain is over and gone. Rise up, my love, and come away.
Thou art become beautiful * O Holy Mother of God! and gentle in thy gladness.
I was created from the beginning, before the world; + and I shall never fail. * In the holy tabernacle I served before him.

Holy Mary * succor the wretched, help the weak-minded, restore the failing, pray for the people, intervene for the clerics, intercede for the devoted female sex: so that all should know your help, whoever celebrates your holy commemoration.
Pray for us O holy Mother of God.
That we should be made worthy of the promises of Christ.

Grant us your servants, we ask you Lord God, to rejoice in perpetual health of mind and body, + and by the glorious intercession of Blessed Mary ever-Virgin, * to be freed from present sorrow, and to enjoy eternal happiness.
Blessed art thou * among women, and blessed is the fruit of thy womb.
Like the best myrrh, * O Holy Mother of God, thou hast yielded a pleasant odour.
Before this maiden's bed * sing for us again and again the tender idylls of the play.

incipit: O how holy and how spotless is thy virginity! I am too dull to praise thee;
responsum: For thou hast borne in thy breast Him Whom the heavens cannot contain.
versus: Blessed art thou among women, and blessed is the fruit of thy womb.

incipit: Blessed art thou, O Virgin Mary, who hast carried the Lord, the Maker of the world.
responsum: Thou hast borne Him Who created thee, and thou abidest a virgin for ever.
versus: Hail, Mary, full of grace. The Lord is with thee.

datum: In thy comeliness * and thy beauty, go forward, fare prosperously, and reign.
God shall give her * the help of His countenance; God is in the midst of her, she shall not be moved.
In gladness * are all we who dwell in thee, O Holy Mother of God.
Joy to thee, O Virgin Mary, * thou hast trampled down all the heresies in the whole world.
My praise by thee accepted be, * Holy Virgin: give me strength against thine enemies.
After thy delivery * thou still remainest a virgin undefiled; Mother of God, pray for us.
in-tempore-adventus: The angel of the Lord * announced unto Mary, and she conceived of the Holy Ghost.

datum: V. Grace is poured into thy lips.
R. Therefore God hath blessed thee for ever.
In the broad ways I gave a sweet smell like cinnamon and aromatic balm; 1 yielded a pleasant odour like the best myrrh.
